response.answer_text: Question: What is the most expensive, but actually totally worthy of it, thing you can think of? Answer: I can think 🤔 of only one thing. This palace in Versailles, France 🇫🇷    How much the world’s most valuable palaces are worth It is estimated to cost around 50.7 Billion Dollars Palace of Versailles, France – $50.7 billion(£39bn)Land costs around $5,000 (£4k) per square meter in the town of Versailles, so the value of the palace's land alone is $40.7 billion(£30.99bn).Oct 6, 2017  Definitely, it is worth it as it’s such a beautiful masterpiece and is full of antiques from its time. Moreover, it’s usefulness and beauty adds more to its value. Sources:- Palace of Versailles - Wikipedia

response.answer_text: We are budgeteers, spread sheet expense trackers, so we have a pretty good idea of the expensive things in our life: Education.Travel. It’s fun but also very educational in so many ways.Charity. We haven’t built a church or even a small sacristy, but the overall feeling of helping people is worth infinitely more than the money we have contributed.Our houses. We have always bought houses on the water (lake, bay, and the ocean). They always cost more than comparable non-water houses, but the view, the experience, and the resale have all made living on the water incredibly worthwhile.Our cars. Early on, we learned to buy really well made cars that last a long time. They may be more expensive in the short term, but in the long run, they are SO worthwhile both in terms of acquisition money spent, maintenance costs, and resale value.
